channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023080885
item.description:
Report E-2023080885

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: ELGIN
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ON August 10,2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of acetic acid was punctured by a forklift and released approximately all its contents to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental to remediate the site. HazChem personnel deployed granular absorbents to the release and worked them in using hand tools. All acetic acid-impacted material was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080696
item.description:
Report E-2023080696

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-18
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 18, 2023, at 0239 ET, XPO Logistics terminal LTU suffered a cargo related release of UN3149 “AcidiShine” to the trailer floor and asphalt lot below from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. On August 18, 2023, at 0530 ET, contractors arrived onsite. Crew confirmed one 55-gallon poly drum of UN3149 “AcidiShine” released due to a pallet nail puncture. Approximately 30-gallons released to a 5’ x 30’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 5’ area of the asphalt lot below. The impacted surfaces and debris were neutralized with a vinegar solution and confirmed neutral with pH test strips. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The empty damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon vented poly drum. All impacted absorbents and cleanup debris were collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023080701
item.description:
Report E-2023080701

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-22
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that a release had occurred inside of one case of pH reducer (un1789) and that the caps were loose on two of the inner poly one gallon jugs and that 2 gallons of product had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into 2 cases of pH reducer (un1789) damaging 5 of the inner poly one gallon jugs and releasing 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: While delivering to their customer in Norman,OK and during off loading in a forklift accident a pallet fell, damaging one case of blue whale muriatic acid (un1789) damaging the 2 inner poly 2 gallon jugs and releasing 4 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023061325
item.description:
Report X-2023061325

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-30T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: GUYMON
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Citizen reported the car releasing. Car was assessed by FD and found to not be leaking while not moving but appeared to have leaked. Hazmat Response Inc responded, investigated, and found that the manway gasket in the cover was deteriorated and was the source of the release. A new over the lip gasket was installed, properly secured, and released back into transportation.
